page.title: 05Scaleby Church
page.content: All Saints' Church probably dates from the early 13th. century; it is built in the Early English style from local stone. At the western end of the church is the tower. It was originally a Pele Tower built about 1360 with 4 feet thick walls and narrow loophole windows. It was a place of safety during border raids. The tower was restored in 1962 by Canon Donaldson. There are two bells, the earliest probably dating from the 14th century. At the west end also is Roman altar stone which is thought to have been brought from{Birdoswald.} There have been earlier restorations, in 1828-9 when pinnacles were added and in 1867. The windows are lancets. Three are stained glass memorials.
